Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-001 What is the role of a Security Operations Center (SOC)?
Options:
• A. Monitor and protect information assets
  • B. Develop software
  • C. Conduct employee training
  • D. Sell cybersecurity tools
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Monitor and protect information assets
  • B. Develop software
  • C. Conduct employee training
  • D. Sell cybersecurity tools
CorrectOptions:
A
Why correct: A Security Operations Center (SOC) continuously oversees an organization’s IT environment to detect, analyze, and respond to cyber threats, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of critical data.
Why incorrect: B is DevOps; C is HR; D is vendor role
Rationale: Tests SOC role
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity soc multiple-choice instance-1

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-005 Which disciplines does DevSecOps integrate? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Software development
  • B. Customer support
  • C. Security operations
  • D. Hardware manufacturing
  • E. Systems operations
  • F. Financial planning
  • G. Quality assurance
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Software development
  • B. Customer support
  • C. Security operations
  • D. Hardware manufacturing
  • E. Systems operations
  • F. Financial planning
  • G. Quality assurance
CorrectOptions:
A,C,E
Why correct: DevSecOps integrates software development (coding applications), security operations (implementing cybersecurity measures), and systems operations (managing IT infrastructure) to embed security throughout the development lifecycle.
Why incorrect: B is support; D is manufacturing; F is finance; G is QA
Rationale: Tests DevSecOps components
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity devsecops multiple-choice instance-1 multiple-correct

Metadata: Multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-009 Which is a security control category? (CHOOSE ONE)
Options:
• A. Technical safeguard measures
  • B. Incident-response workflow team
  • C. Vendor-provided security toolkit
  • D. Compliance-review steering committee
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Technical safeguard measures
  • B. Incident-response workflow team
  • C. Vendor-provided security toolkit
  • D. Compliance-review steering committee
CorrectOptions:
A
Why correct: Technical safeguard measures use technology, such as firewalls or encryption, to protect systems and data from cyber threats.
Why incorrect: B, C, D are cybersecurity groups or tools, not control categories.
Rationale: Tests control categories
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity controls multiple-choice instance-1

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-010 Which is a security control category? (CHOOSE ONE)
Options:
• A. Centralized monitoring operations center
  • B. Operational policy and procedure sets
  • C. Simulated-attack validation crew
  • D. Quantitative risk-scoring council
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Centralized monitoring operations center
  • B. Operational policy and procedure sets
  • C. Simulated-attack validation crew
  • D. Quantitative risk-scoring council
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: Operational policy and procedure sets involve processes, like security training or incident response plans, to maintain system security.
Why incorrect: A, C, D are cybersecurity groups or operations, not control categories.

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-011 Which are security control categories? (CHOOSE TWO)
Options:
• A. Physical access restriction mechanisms
  • B. Asset-class inventory squad
  • C. Managerial governance framework
  • D. External-audit oversight panel
  • E. Crisis-mitigation task force
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Physical access restriction mechanisms
  • B. Asset-class inventory squad
  • C. Managerial governance framework
  • D. External-audit oversight panel
  • E. Crisis-mitigation task force
CorrectOptions:
A,C
Why correct: Physical access restriction mechanisms, like locks or guards, protect assets; Managerial governance framework, like risk assessments, guides security strategy.
Why incorrect: B, D, E are cybersecurity groups, not control categories.
Rationale: Tests control categories
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity controls multiple-choice instance-3 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-012 Which are security control categories? (CHOOSE TWO)
Options:
• A. Employee-awareness training unit
  • B. Technology-based defensive controls
  • C. Perimeter-hardware maintenance group
  • D. Physical access restriction systems
  • E. Cryptographic protocol design lab
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Employee-awareness training unit
  • B. Technology-based defensive controls
  • C. Perimeter-hardware maintenance group
  • D. Physical access restriction systems
  • E. Cryptographic protocol design lab
CorrectOptions:
B,D
Why correct: Technology-based defensive controls use technology, like encryption, to secure systems; Physical access restriction systems, like access badges or locks, prevent physical breaches.
Why incorrect: A, C, E are cybersecurity groups, not control categories.
Rationale: Tests control categories
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity controls multiple-choice instance-4 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-013 Which are principles of the CIA triad? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Data confidentiality
  • B. User authentication
  • C. Information integrity
  • D. Access authorization
  • E. Identity verification
  • F. System availability
  • G. Control access management
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Data confidentiality
  • B. User authentication
  • C. Information integrity
  • D. Access authorization
  • E. Identity verification
  • F. System availability
  • G. Control access management
CorrectOptions:
A,C,F
Why correct: Data confidentiality protects information from unauthorized access; Information integrity ensures data accuracy and trustworthiness; System availability maintains access for authorized users.
Why incorrect: B, D, E, G are identity and access management concepts, not CIA principles.
Rationale: Tests CIA components
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.2
Tags: Section::1.2 cybersecurity cia multiple-choice instance-1 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-014 Which are principles of the CIA triad? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Access authorization
  • B. Data confidentiality
  • C. Control access management
  • D. Information integrity
  • E. Identity verification
  • F. User authentication
  • G. System availability

• A. Access authorization
  • B. Data confidentiality
  • C. Control access management
  • D. Information integrity
  • E. Identity verification
  • F. User authentication
  • G. System availability
CorrectOptions:
B,D,G
Why correct: Data confidentiality safeguards sensitive information; Information integrity maintains data consistency; System availability ensures system uptime for authorized users.
Why incorrect: A, E, F are identity-related; C is a security mechanism, not a CIA principle.

Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.2
Tags: Section::1.2 cybersecurity cia multiple-choice instance-2 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-017 Which is a common threat actor?
Options:
• A. Nation-state
  • B. Incident response team
  • C. Security vendor group
  • D. Compliance audit team
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Nation-state
  • B. Incident response team
  • C. Security vendor group
  • D. Compliance audit team
CorrectOptions:
A
Why correct: Nation-state actors are government-backed entities conducting cyberattacks for strategic objectives, such as espionage or infrastructure disruption.
Why incorrect: B, C, D are legitimate cybersecurity groups, not threat actors.
Rationale: Tests threat actor recall
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::2.1
Tags: Section::2.1 cybersecurity threat-actors multiple-choice instance-1
